conclusion: Determine the length L_n of the n-th metal cylinder and the velocity v_1 of the electron as it enters cylinder 1.
Analyze the motion of the electron from the moment it starts moving from the circular plate until it exits cylinder 2.
The key is understanding the timing of the electric fields in the gaps between the cylinders.
Electric field in the gap changes sign every half period T/2.
Electron must be accelerated in the gaps and decelerated inside the cylinders.
The time for the electron to travel from the circular plate to the first cylinder is t_1.
The distance d_0 from the circular plate to the first cylinder is d_0 = 1/2 a t_1^2.
Electric field in the gap is E = U/d.
The time to travel from the circular plate to the first cylinder is t_1 = d_0/v_0.
Electron starts from rest, v_0 = 0.
The distance d_0 is the distance the electron travels in time t_1 under constant acceleration a.
The time for the electron to travel from the first cylinder to the second cylinder is t_2.
The distance L_1 is L_1 = 1/2 a t_2^2.
The time for the electron to travel from the second cylinder to the third cylinder is t_3.
The distance L_2 is L_2 = 1/2 a t_3^2.
Electron must be in the gap between the cylinders.
The time for the electron to travel from (n-1)-th cylinder to n-th cylinder is t_n.
The distance L_{n-1} is L_{n-1} = 1/2 a t_n^2.
The time for the electron to travel from n-th cylinder to (n+1)-th cylinder is t_{n+1}.
The distance L_n is L_n = 1/2 a t_{n+1}^2.
The total time for the electron to travel from the circular plate to the n-th cylinder is t_n.
